programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: Coverage of the ninth day's play at Roland Garros, where the fourth-round singles matches are scheduled to conclude in the second Grand Slam tournament of the year, as the quest to succeed last year's singles champions Novak Djokovic and Garbine Muguruza continues. This day in 2016 saw a full day's play cancelled for the first time in 16 years due to heavy rain. The organisers, players and fans will desperately be hoping for more friendly weather conditions this time around, as while a roof is being planned for Court Philippe Chatrier, it is not scheduled to be ready until 2020.(n)

programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: Coverage of the 10th day's play at Roland Garros, where the opening men's and women's quarter-finals are set to take place in the second Grand Slam tournament of the year. For the second day in succession at this stage 12 months ago, play was heavily hit by rain, with only two of the already postponed fourth-round matches being completed. Tsventana Pironkova reached the quarter-finals of this tournament for the first time by shocking second seed Agnieska Radwanska with a 2-6, 6-3, 6-3 victory. The lower-ranked player also prevailed in the other contest, with 2010 runner-up Samantha Stosur defeating 2014 finalist Simona Halep 7-6, 6-3.(n)
